document.title: Bacterial and parasitic zoonoses of exotic pets
document.abstract: Zoonoses are estimated to make up to 75% of today's emerging infectious diseases. Many of these diseases are carried and transmitted by exotic pets and wildlife. Exotic animal practitioners must be aware of these risks not only to protect their health but also to safeguard the health of staff and clients. This article reviews selected bacterial and parasitic zoonoses associated with exotic animals.
document.publication-title: Faculty Publications and Other Works -- Biomedical and Diagnostic Sciences

field.name: custom_citation
